comments: Although he\'s not the Buddha himself, the way he leads his classroom and teaches his knowledge to others is almost like Siddhartha Buddha. If you want to be empowered to do something or speak publicly, then take his class.

Erik is passionate about what he is teaching and cares about his students. He is always there when you need help, and makes coming to class fun with group activities, discussions, and his personal stories. I gained a lot of valuable, real-life skills from his class.
One of the few professors at ACC that seems to actually care about his students. Not bad to look at either. :-)
Great instructor if you are wanting to work hard. Otherwise, you should take someone elses course and undervalue yourself. If you want to step up to the plate, take Erik\'s class.
Great instructor if you are wanting to work hard. Otherwise, you should take someone elses course and undervalue yourself. If you want to step up to the plate, take Erik\'s class.

Erik is a great instructor. He is willing to work with students and provide additional feedback. The great thing about Erik is he is willing to improve his teaching skills by asking students for feedback about his classes. If you study and complete the required speeches you should do great. I did and I was scared (still am) of public speaking.
